channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Live: Thousands gather in Auckland for Black Lives Matter solidarity march
item.description: Thousands have joined large numbers of Americans in protesting the killing of Minneapolis man George Floyd in a protest starting from Aotea Square in central Auckland.

item.title: Pioneer in deer industry, zoo conservation dedicates award to supporters
item.description: A man who received a Queen's Birthday honour for services to wildlife conservation and the deer industry says the award is shared with everyone who's made a contribution.

item.title: Yacht swept to shore, longliner leaking fuel in Coromandel Peninsula
item.description: A yacht has been swept to shore, while a commercial longliner is taking on water and leaking fuel on the Coromandel Peninsula.

item.title: Covid-19: No new cases in New Zealand for 10th day in a row
item.description: There are again no new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand, the 10th day in a row of no new cases.

item.title: Human rights advocate hopes Covid-19 can bring lasting change in NZ
item.description: Fighting for equality is more important than ever before, says a former Human Rights Commissioner who is a Queen's Birthday honours recipient.

item.title: Plea for help in identifying injured pedestrian in Wellington Hospital
item.description: Police are asking for help to identify a patient in Wellington Hospital after he was hit by a car and lost consciousness last week.

item.title: Taranaki 'shovel ready' projects still in contention for funds
item.description: Five Taranaki projects have made the shortlist for government funding for 'shovel-ready' projects, including a revamp to Yarrow Stadium, but some aren't so convinced.

item.title: Immigration category's planned return scuttled by Covid-19
item.description: After a wait of more than three years for a government decision on family migration, grandparents had a glimmer of hope - before the coronavirus snuffed it out again.

item.title: World's first openly transgender MP 'humbled' by Queen's Birthday Honour
item.description: The world's first transgender mayor and MP has been awarded for her services to the LGBTQI community.

item.title: Heavy rain, strong winds continue for North Island during long weekend
item.description: Holiday makers are facing lengthy traffic delays as the Coromandel with heavy downpours and wind.

item.title: Kaikōura Highway set to be finished this year
item.description: The Kaikōura Highway is on track to be completed by the end of the year, the rebuild construction alliance has said.

item.title: Man dead after early morning firearms incident in Auckland
item.description: Police were called to an address after reports of gun shots and people screaming. A man was later found dead.

item.title: Three new dames and two new knights in this year's Queen's Birthday honours
item.description: A director, an ex-All Black, medical researchers, leading Māori artists and authors are among those recognised in this year's Queen's Birthday honours.

item.title: Specialist teams flying to site of fatal glider crash
item.description: Two people were killed when a glider crashed near Taupō and weather permitting, their bodies will be removed today.

item.title: Man who killed mum and toddler to be deported
item.description: A Fijian man who murdered his ex-girlfriend and her young daughter and buried them near an Auckland bus station has lost his battle against deportation.

item.title: Glider crashes near Taupō
item.description: Two people are dead following a glider crash near Taupō this afternoon.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand for ninth straight day - Health Ministry
item.description: There are no new cases of Covid-19 today, and still just one active case, the Health Ministry has confirmed.

item.title: Severe weather to hit North Island, with more rain, strong winds predicted next week
item.description: Forecasted severe weather is moving south onto the upper North Island today, and it's predicted to bring with it heavy rain and gales.
